title: Creating and Using Functions
description: Practice defining functions with parameters and return values
starterCode:
# Task 1: Define a function called 'greet_user' that takes a name parameter
# and returns a greeting string: "Hello, [name]!"


# Task 2: Define a function called 'multiply' that takes two parameters (a, b)
# and returns their product


# Task 3: Define a function called 'is_adult' that takes an age parameter
# and returns True if age >= 18, False otherwise


# Task 4: Define a function called 'calculate_rectangle_area'
# that takes width and height parameters and returns the area


# Test your functions (don't modify these)
greeting = greet_user("Alice")
product = multiply(6, 7)
adult_check = is_adult(25)
area = calculate_rectangle_area(10, 5)
hints: Use 'def' keyword to define a function
Boolean comparisons return True or False automatically

testCases.validation: assert 'greet_user' in dir(), 'Function greet_user not found'
assert greeting == 'Hello, Alice!', f'Expected "Hello, Alice!" but got "{greeting}"'
assert 'multiply' in dir(), 'Function multiply not found'
assert 'is_adult' in dir(), 'Function is_adult not found'

testCases.description: is_adult should return True for age 25
testCases.validation: assert adult_check == True, f'Expected True but got {adult_check}'

testCases.description: is_adult should return False for age under 18
testCases.validation: assert is_adult(15) == False, 'Should return False for age under 18'
assert 'calculate_rectangle_area' in dir(), 'Function calculate_rectangle_area not found'
